elements.title: Anjou: New card game inspired by ancient Bible at KU Leuven (The Brussels Times - Art & Culture)
elements.contents:
Anjou: New card game inspired by ancient Bible at KU Leuven

"We can enjoy the colorful and mythological images in the Bible while playing the card game."

Thursday, 7 March 2024

elements.title: EU sanctions 33 individuals for Navalny's death (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
EU sanctions 33 individuals for Navalny's death

All the sanctioned individuals now face a freeze on their assets, a financing ban within the EU and travel restrictions.

Saturday, 23 March 2024

elements.title: Belgian Presidency postpones Nature Restoration Law indefinitely (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Belgian Presidency postpones Nature Restoration Law indefinitely

After De Croo's alleged lobbying caused a fuss earlier this week, the Belgian Presidency of the Council of the EU has now quietly shelved the Nature Restoration Law.

Friday, 22 March 2024

elements.title: EU supports Ukraine even more, amends common position on the Middle East (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
EU supports Ukraine even more, amends common position on the Middle East

“The support to Ukraine against Russia’s war of aggression and the Middle East conflict dominated the discussions.”

Friday, 22 March 2024

elements.title: Protestors denounce EU 'appeasement' of Iran outside Summit (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Protestors denounce EU 'appeasement' of Iran outside Summit

Protestors denounce the EU's failure to label the Revolutionary Guards a terrorist organisation.

Friday, 22 March 2024

elements.title: Some 30 countries reaffirm the place of nuclear energy at Brussels summit (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Some 30 countries reaffirm the place of nuclear energy at Brussels summit

In a joint declaration, they stressed that nuclear energy is crucial to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, ensure energy security and promote sustainable development.

Friday, 22 March 2024

elements.title: Voting now compulsory for people aged 16 and 17 in Belgium, Court rules (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Voting now compulsory for people aged 16 and 17 in Belgium, Court rules

It remains unclear how the decision will impact all 16- and 17-year-old EU nationals living in Belgium, who only have several days left to register to vote.

elements.title: 'If it is true, it is unprecedented': De Croo accused of lobbying EU Member States on nature law (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)

elements.contents:
Revenues from frozen Russian assets will be used for military support to Ukraine

elements.title: EU enlargement: Commission wants 'gradual' integration of new members (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
EU enlargement: Commission wants 'gradual' integration of new members

The European Commission wants to ensure both the EU and prospective members are comprehensively prepared for enlargement.

elements.title: 'Ultimately, we all pay the price': EU pledges €7.7 billion in crisis relief (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
'Ultimately, we all pay the price': EU pledges €7.7 billion in crisis relief

The EU will launch a study initiative aiming to promote international law compliance in conflicts across the world.

elements.title: Top EU diplomat to propose using 90% of profits from frozen Russian assets to arm Ukraine (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Top EU diplomat to propose using 90% of profits from frozen Russian assets to arm Ukraine

"The summer will be decisive", stressed Borrell, who expects a major Russian offensive against Ukraine during this period.

elements.title: Energy, migration and money: EU to sign a €7.4 billion partnership agreement with Egypt (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Energy, migration and money: EU to sign a €7.4 billion partnership agreement with Egypt

After deals with Tunisia and Mauritania in recent months, the third agreement of its kind is set to be signed this Sunday in Cairo.

elements.title: After Qatargate, the EU will have a new ethics watchdog (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
After Qatargate, the EU will have a new ethics watchdog

"For far too long, breaches of the relatively-good lobbying rules in Brussels have gone unpunished."

Sunday, 17 March 2024

elements.title: Farmer protests: European Commission slashes EU environmental standards (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
Farmer protests: European Commission slashes EU environmental standards

A Belgian farmers union did not welcome the announcement: "From the outset, we have been calling for action on prices, not on environmental standards."

Saturday, 16 March 2024

elements.title: EU aid to produce two million shells within two years (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:
EU aid to produce two million shells within two years

EU leaders had pledged a million shells for Ukraine by the end of March 2024, a goal that will not be met. They hope to deliver by the end of this year.

elements.title: Congolese women stage sit-in to denounce the EU-Rwanda agreement on minerals (The Brussels Times - EU Affairs)
elements.contents:

elements.contents:

elements.contents:

elements.contents:

elements.contents:

"Whatever microplastic is doing to human health, nanoplastics are going to be more dangerous." By comparison, tap water is much less affected.

elements.title: Nine hanged for drug trafficking in Iran (The Brussels Times - World)
elements.contents:

Iran issued at least 173 death sentences for drug crimes from January to May 2023, according to Amnesty International. Only China executed more people.

elements.contents:

elements.contents:

elements.title: The sound of Brussels: One in three residents afflicted by excessive noise pollution (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
The sound of Brussels: One in three residents afflicted by excessive noise pollution

The highest levels of noise pollution are in the north and the east of the region; richer areas in south of the region are much less affected.

Friday, 15 March 2024

elements.title: 'Onument' to Covid-19 victims unveiled in Brussels (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
'Onument' to Covid-19 victims unveiled in Brussels

The monument unveiled in Brussels is one of six across the country that together form a perfect circle. It is located in Osseghem Park, beside the Atomium.

Wednesday, 13 March 2024

elements.title: 'Enough unnecessary suffering': Brussels sued for allowing unanaesthetised slaughter (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
'Enough unnecessary suffering': Brussels sued for allowing unanaesthetised slaughter

Ritual slaughter without stunning is banned in Flanders and Wallonia, but in Brussels over 30,000 animals are still slaughtered whilst conscious every year.

elements.title: Brussels' first wooden high-rise made in chocolate for 'Oscars of real estate' (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
Brussels' first wooden high-rise made in chocolate for 'Oscars of real estate'

The unique work, 100% made of milk and dark chocolate, is 75 centimetres high and 50 centimetres wide, weighing no less than 35 kilograms.

elements.contents:
Stabbing in Laeken on Saturday night, perpetrator still on the run

The suspect had already fled when police arrived at the scene of the stabbing. The victim's condition is no longer life-threatening.

elements.contents:

elements.contents:
What to do in Brussels this weekend: 8 to 10 March

From tours through buildings that are normally closed to visitors to a fair dedicated to path-breaking 21st-century design, here's what's on in Brussels this weekend.

elements.title: Belgium in Brief: Buses from North Station – convenience or chaos? (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
Belgium in Brief: Buses from North Station – convenience or chaos?

The Northern Quarter has become the landing point of buses from across the continent. This was never the plan but can Brussels agree on a better spot?

elements.contents:

Despite emergency services’ efforts to resuscitate the woman upon arrival at the scene, she passed away in hospital. The two shootings are not related.

elements.title: Upgrading Brussels' skyline: Midi Tower renovations to cost €141 million (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:

Belgium's tallest building needs urgent renovations, ideally completed before the nation's 200th birthday. But ministers are already wincing at the cost.

elements.title: Highlighting heritage: Major works start on Place Royale in Brussels (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
Highlighting heritage: Major works start on Place Royale in Brussels

Only 20% of the space is reserved for pedestrians now, but by the end of the works, 85% of the emblematic square will be car-free.

elements.title: Brussels to restore Place Luxembourg’s central green space (The Brussels Times - Brussels 2)
elements.contents:
